text: Bad Hindelang is a municipality in the district of Oberallgäu in Bavaria in Germany. From 2008 it has a population of 4,915. It is known for its sulphur springs and pure mountain air. Today the municipality is a health resort. It is above sea level. == Mayors == * 1900-1919: Josef Anton Blanz * 1920-1933: Michael Haas * 1933-1939: Anton Schmid * 1939-1945: Karl Blanz * 1945-1947: Max Zillibiller, CSU * 1947-1948: Xaver Blenk * 1948-1960: Alois Haug * 1960-1984: Georg Scholl, CSU * 1984-2008: Roman Haug, Freie Wähler * 2008–present: Adalbert Martin, CSU == Photo gallery == File:City hall of Bad Hindelang on a sunny summer day.jpg|Town hall File: StJodokus.jpg|Church of St. Jodokus File:PestkapelleHindelang.jpg|Evangelical church File:Hinterstein Kutschenmuseum Zillibiller-Viktoria.jpg|Hinterstein Carriage Museum File:HintersteinSteinadler.jpg|Konrad Zuse's computer Z4 was hidden in a shed of this (former) Steinadler inn in March 1945 File:Catholic church St. John the Baptist in Bad Hindelang from east.jpg|Catholic church St. John the Baptist File:BadHindelangKapelle1-2.jpg|Gefallenen-Gedenkkapelle File:BruckKapelle.jpg|Kapelle in Bruck File:Bad_Hindelang_Hammerschmiede_01.jpg|Hammerschmiede in Bad Hindelang File:Adler-Post.jpg|Gasthof Adler-Post File:HindelangSonne.jpg|Hotel Sonne == References == == Additional Reading == * Wolfgang B.
